title: B. Beautiful Divisors
statement:
Recently Luba learned about a special kind of numbers that she calls beautiful numbers. The number is called beautiful iff its binary representation consists of k + 1 consecutive ones, and then k consecutive zeroes.

Some examples of beautiful numbers:

  • 12 (110);
  • 1102 (610);
  • 11110002 (12010);
  • 1111100002 (49610).

More formally, the number is beautiful iff there exists some positive integer k such that the number is equal to (2k - 1) * (2k - 1).

Luba has got an integer number n, and she wants to find its greatest beautiful divisor. Help her to find it!
inputSpecification: The only line of input contains one number n (1 ≤ n ≤ 105) — the number Luba has got.
outputSpecification: Output one number — the greatest beautiful divisor of Luba's number. It is obvious that the answer always exists.
name: Beautiful Divisors
